channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The U.S. has ‘escalation dominance’ in a debt war: Europe would face a violent market crash if it dumps Treasuries
item.description: Europe accounts for about a third of U.S. government bonds held overseas, or roughly 10% of the overall Treasury market.

item.title: Michelle Obama says friendships are as important as college degrees, job titles, and salary: ‘You’ve got to be really smart and selective about who you let in’
item.description: The former first lady says it’s important to make new friends, but advises people to be picky about who they let stick around. Longtime duos, like Opr...

item.title: Trump cancels Puerto Rico solar project designed to help 30,000 low-income families in rural areas
item.description: Javier Rúa Jovet, public policy director for Puerto Rico’s Solar and Energy Storage Association, disputed the Trump rationale for the move.

item.title: IMF chief sees global GDP growth as ‘beautiful but not enough’ to handle ‘the debt that is hanging around our necks’
item.description: Governments need to take care of “those who are falling off the wagon," Kristalina Georgieva said on a panel discussion in Davos.

item.title: As Winter Storm Fern barrels in, all eyes are on the Weather Channel. Its CEO is charting the company’s next big forecast: growth
item.description: CEO Rohit Agarwal says hype and scaremongering amid a dangerous storm are counter-productive when the company is building its business based on trust.

item.title: Inflation is an ‘economic thief.’ Can the Fed finally stop its frustrating rise?
Dow falls as banks stocks struggle, while tech drives Nasdaq higher — live
Nearly 2,000 flights in U.S. canceled — so far — ahead of forecast winter storm
Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq all close on weekly losses, as silver tops $100 an ounce
Silver finally hit $100 an ounce. Some experts say it's just the beginning.
